intro: Rinorea ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri Rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
